Description.Text: 42 The Calls Hotel is located on the edge of the River Aire, in a vibrant area of the city of Leeds. The Calls is fast becoming one of the most stylish and trendy parts of the city. The hotel was converted from derelict corn mill in 1991 and many bedrooms within the hotel still boast many of the original features. The Calls has many trendy bars & restaurants and is still located within minutes walk of the city centre, Harvey Nichols and the Victoria Quarter, which hosts many designer shops and boutiques. The hotel is just 5 minutes walk from the Train Station and approximately 9 miles to the nearest airport (Leeds & Bradford). 41 Bedrooms in total all with privacy hatches to the side of the bedroom door, this is where hotel deliver your room service breakfast, your morning newspaper or even deliver your polished shoes back to you. 42 The Calls boasts One Penthouse Suite, Two Suites, Six Director Rooms, Superior & Deluxe Rooms & Study Rooms, some bedrooms have views over the River Aire. Bedrooms vary in size and style but are united by the common values of comfort and quality. Additional amenity information: 24 hour room service,Housekeeping & turndown service, Same day laundry and dry cleaning, Overnight shoe-shine, Safe deposit facility, Secretarial Support, Complimentary Wi-fi throughout, Concierge for restaurant and theatre reservations, Limousine and car rental. Amenities providing by the property are Conference facilities, High-speed Internet access, Pets allowed, Room service, Wireless Internet and Smoke free property. The nearest car park to the hotel is the Markets NCP located on New York Street next to the Bus Station. You are welcome to drop your luggage off at the hotel before you park your car and we will be delighted to direct you to the car park from the hotel. You can purchase an exit car park ticket from Reception on departure at the cost of 14.75 for 24 hours, please retain your entrance car park ticket as you will need this also to exit the car park along with your purchased ticket.

A central setting overlooking the River Aire that is just a few minutes walk from Leeds City Centre. It also has easy access to the area's sporting venues including the world famous Headingley Cricket Ground and the stunning Yorkshire Dales. A short distance from the railway station and a 25 minute drive from Leeds and Bradford Airport. Leeds is about 2 hours by train from London and 4 hours by car.

Director King - Director King double bedrooms are all a large size double room with separate seating area, the majority river facing, all amenities included and full en-suite facilities. All bedrooms have Complimentary Wireless Internet connection and Interactive TV available, most rooms have plasma screens, the ETV system has a large selection of Satellite Channels. Bedrooms vary in size and style but are united by the common values of comfort and quality. All rooms have lunxury toiletries, Frog Soaps, & bathrobes. Each room has a privacy hatch located next to the bedroom door, Handmade beds with Luxury Cotton Linen, mini bar, hot beverage tray with homemade biscuits, Iron & Ironing Board, trouser press, hairdryer, complimentary mineral water and homemade fudge.
Deluxe Double - Deluxe double bedrooms are an average/large size double room, all amenities included and full en-suite facilities. All bedrooms have complimentary Wireless Internet connection and Interactive TV available, most rooms have plasma screens, the ETV system has a large selection of Satellite Channels. Bedrooms vary in size and style but are united by the common values of comfort and quality. All rooms have luxury toiletries, Frog Soaps, & bathrobes. Each room has a privacy hatch located next to the bedroom door, Handmade beds with Luxury Cotton Linen, mini bar, hot beverage tray with homemade biscuits, Iron & Ironing Board, trouser press, hairdryer, complimentary mineral water and homemade fudge.
